comment.body: Пусть сначала со своим потреблением памяти справятся.
@Kids : Благодарю. Он же отвечает за управление HTTP-прокси? И да, для одной из нижеупомянутых целей у меня уже используется публичный .pac от АнтиЗапрета. Могу я в своём файле сослаться на внешний?

Hope Debian and Lineage OS were safe.
P.S. Looks like forced migration to GNU/Linux is useless, especially in this particular case. As Russian state clinics did so, some specialists started to bring their own Windows laptops just to run their specifis software like MRT data viewers.
That must be why I was happy replacing my Macbook although the "new" laptop had terribly inefficient cooling and, according to my friends, a weaker GPU...

@styromaniac@zeroid.bit: When I told my groupmate the same, he said that he doesn't have enough money to replace his laptop with a non-Apple one. Of course he hasn't enough money - as he has spent it all on the Mac...
(Also that must be why he is going to be sent down, as now he isn't even able to get into a paid group - not to mention his such "respectful" current marks).
But... is there someone to be stalked by someone other than the FBI (or their local colleagues/rivals)? As for clearnet, there is Senpai, but, in my case, she doesn't know anything about dark Web(s).
Maybe the real question is "where it's an only option, would it worth it?"
@mxh69420: does torsocks work? Or FreeCap on Windows, or SocksTap (aka SSTap) at the worst case.

Yesterday
All my trouble seems so far away...

How lucky I was deciding to migrate to a PocketPC-powered communicator right at the time I got troubles with my data plan and got connected to Yo(p)ta^tm in just a couple of moths after having to migrate back.
@mxh69420: you definitely should do that. If you're lucky enough not to have any important Google-dependent apps. Otherwise... it'd probably be wise to also "fakegoogle" using microG.
Some weeks ago, I configured Zoom to run via Tor and it felt fine. Through it appears that it might has failed to connect to Tor and has fallen back to direct connection quietly.
Does Minecraft make use of UDP? It yes, that's the reason because proxies don't support it (AFAIK there is a workaround exists actually).
LOL, someone is going to have a bad time.
